Each time I wanted something I had to practically wave my arms to get attention.  I ordered a drink during happy hour (a Moscow mule) and no one had any idea how much it would cost (one time it was $5, another $12).  The bartenders seemed to treat the customers as an annoyance.  As for the food, well, in a word it mostly sucked.  The "hand rolled tater tots" were huge masses of potato which just tasted like mush.  Almost everything on the menu was fried and bland.  Whoever is doing the menu is not much of a cook.  Sadly, the food across the street at the Rogue is better and that's not saying much.  I don't see myself going here again.

S2qvRVfSD6sw6b4rtGFJ2Q.review_text: officially the worst restaurant in san francisco. everything was awful. the service was just bad. our waitress didn't know anything about the menu, or service in a restaurant. she kept on bumping into me, she forgot to put the order for the food. cocktails were so bad we had to return them, i had better cocktails on a flight. food was terrible. not interesting to begin with and just didn't taste good at all. and for all of that we ended up paying much more than what the food there is worth. i'm not going to be back. just not worth it.

pux3tZ32Am3qU20LVxAFWA.review_text: Great Food!  Service a tad slow but it was worth the wait.  Great bacon and the sourdough toast was fantastic.  Very San Francisco!

NMNauN3TXZapniWfQ6rYFw.review_text: After wandering from FiDi to NB for over an hour looking for a non-packed, walk-in taking restaurant on a Friday evening, we stumbled upon The Square. I was actually looking for Bottle Caps, learned that it was closed, and didn't realize that this place took over till I read some of the reviews just now. It was packed when we walked in but luckily on the bar side of the restaurant a table had just paid we literally waited for 1 minute instead of 180 minutes.   The food was good, not the greatest I ever tasted but I was definitely satisfied. We had the guinea hen and the trout. The portions are pretty small.. if it weren't for two pieces of free bread, and our "free" order of beans (which were a little TOO SALTY - also, free is in quotations because when I come to think of it, I feel like they charged us although we didn't look too closely at the bill), I think I would have still been hungry after dinner.    Service was very attentive. A little over compensating. They kept apologizing for us waiting so long, but we didn't even think we had been, which got a little blegh.   Overall, I enjoyed my experience, but probably wouldn't frequent this place.

pGd3fzv1jWE-nnFj9QHy_A.review_text: Absolutely exceptional food and service! Lovely neighborhood restaurant with a great atmosphere! Most of the ingredients are self-grown on the biodanamic Dark Hill Farm - wonderful concept! Constantly changing menus make this place a location to come back and back again. Amazing restaurant in the North Beach Neighborhood

a1gpp6NErV-qBcrB6PlA1g.review_text: Third time here. We came for brunch on a Sunday morning and had hoped for the same brunch menu as last time. Nope! It changed. We were sad to see the fried chicken with biscuit and gravy gone from the menu. I ordered the farm egg sandwich and my husband got the pork belly hash. You know its bad when you say the fries are the best thing.   Egg sandwich - big piece of roll with stuff in between. My egg was cooked over medium. Who eats a sandwich with yolk running everywhere? The bacon was mediocre with a huge slice of tomato and some arugula (like 3 pieces). I didn't eat half of it  Pork Belly hash - it was mostly potato with a few pieces of pork belly and a lot of egg. Did not taste good at all. My husband said it was bad  Service = horrible!!! They never refilled our coffee or water until we were done and never came to check on us. This place isn't packed since i am sitting here writing this review right now  In the end, we are taking it off our list of places to eat and not recommending.

7B2btJ-1YZ9oKrE_xeV_gw.user_location: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
7B2btJ-1YZ9oKrE_xeV_gw.review_text: Strong food choice, beer selection is solid. Great neighborhood spot. Great lighting.

4MzhTjmU8G8yUsIAa_omlw.review_text: This place is a self service restaurant with $16 burgers. No service, plastic cups w/ paper napkins, sub-par food, no atmosphere and no customers (see the pic I uploaded take at 7:30pm on a Wednesday night).

RSCmugPhh2R5tJOAYklzdQ.review_text: Amazing restaurant, fabulous food will definitely go back for more.  The menu is fresh, innovative, interesting and different.  Every dish we had was enjoyed by the entire table.  Great location and cool space.

D5uMny1pAVWhNGDvFDPp8g.review_text: A very packed and busy neighborhood joint with good service and average food. Not destination dining but sure to be popular with the Marina and Pacific Height Crowd.  Food- upscale American  1.warm olives-pleasant but forgettable 7  2.Fried Bean-I had thought they would be tempured green beans but they were garbanzo beans and very tasty 7  3.Steak Tartare- very traditonal and unseasoned, didn't seen hand cut but tasty with an egg yolk on top and salt and vinegar chips 14  4. Fennel soup-this had the most interesting flavour and the server divided it into two bowls since we were sharing without us even needing to ask.  5. Asparagus with whey foam and speck- this was a disappointing with six tiny spears with a cream from whey.  6. Barley Risotto 14 this was a hearty risotto with a wild mushrooms on top in a pretty presentation.  7. complimentary bread rolls and sparkling water.  Overall the food was good but not exceptional.   Service- was excellent especially for a place open such a short time. The host station always had a person there. The bussers were almost too efficient. The server took it upon himself to make all the dishes were shared and was good about answering questions. The restaurant has a 15% percent flat service fee which the French Spouse likes but I think means that people probably wouldn't tip on top that. The service charge was done before tax not after as Patrick R. claimed.  The biggest negative of the place was the noise. Even with some sound panels on the ceiling, it was incredibly loud with a full house.

xMNS7Ryl1ptKLE9Ki5Zw1Q.review_text: I was too hard on this place at first. I'm coming around on it.   It's missing something though. I can't quite put my finger on it. I'm thinking maybe a few games of some sort, perhaps some live events and a better sound system.   But the people are nice and it feels very neighborhoody. I'll take it.

gayfgxrWRmnJoQZCqP4RpQ.review_text: Came here on a weekend night. Was a little apprehensive of the prices since the restaurant looked pretty new and like a lot had been put into the decor. Surprisingly everything was reasonable, especially for SF. I ordered the burger and a beer, my friends got some of the other house favorites. Everything was spot on tasty. I'd classify it as high quality comfort food a la San Francisco. I would definitely come back here again the next time I'm in SF and get adventurous with my menu choice.

NRQ7RN_opFn_q3aB80vJMg.review_text: We tried this place for the first time and are pleased to have the addition to the neighborhood. The service was friendly & not overly intrusive. The atmosphere seems to be a distinct upgrade over the previous tenants.  To start our meal, we split some oysters, which were served with a wonderfully bright champagne & shallot dressing which really played well against the brine. We also tried their tartare which was a touch underseasoned but that was made up for by the salt & vinegar chips that it accompanied it. For entrees, I had the guinea hen, which was a nice size, well prepared, and came set on a delicious sunchoke puree. My husband went basic and tried the burger, which was very tasty and held it's own against the other options in the neighborhood.  We definitely plan on returning, next time to split the crab for two! The Square earned a place in the rotation of our neighborhood spots.

IwS23TY4UtOIehxnYekCOg.user_location: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
IwS23TY4UtOIehxnYekCOg.review_text: No stars! Second time trying The Square and didn't even get to order due to wait staff. I've not seen service this bad in SF! It was Sunday at 1pm and the place was virtually empty. Walked out due lack of service. Hope you have deep enough pockets to keep this 'white elephant' alive. Good luck!
